> i would like to know java programmers in the sf area who would like
> meet in sf to work thru the book "Java Tools for eXtreme Programming"
> by Hightower. i have access to developer's license of weblogic
> application server and i can host any time day or night(within
> reason). the book is great and covers Ant, JUnit, Cactus, HttpUnit,
> etc. Please contact me at      roberteganus@...

I bough the same book last year.  While I was flipping through some pages in
the bookshop, I thought it was a great book.  So I bought it straightaway.
However, I got very disappointed after I'd got back home and took my time to
went through the details.

Take ant for example, the presented material looks suspiciously like a cut
down version of those from ant docs.  I used it for a couple of times, but
at the end I was so fed up and just used the ant docs directly.  Although
the docs have their fair share of inaccuracy, I've been very happy with
them.

Pretty much the same verdict applies to other topics as well.

Sorry about the moaning, but I really don't like the book.  Anyway, thanks
for the offer, I'll consider it when I've finished my current project.

Regards,
Yiu Wing
